meanings.sent1: The abducent force pulled the object away.
meanings.sent2: Her abducent behavior made her stand out from the group.
meanings.sent3: The abducent cat kept sneaking out of the house.
meanings.sent4: His abducent gaze drew me in like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The abducent wind carried the leaves far away.

meanings.definition: A muscle that abducts a part of the body.
meanings.sent1: The abducent in his arm allowed him to raise it sideways.
meanings.sent2: She felt a twinge in her abducent after the workout.
meanings.sent3: The abducent flexed proudly during the fitness competition.
meanings.sent4: His abducent was sore from all the lifting.
meanings.sent5: The abducent in her leg helped her balance on one foot.
